result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly D Sheehan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kimberly D Sheehan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kimberly D Sheehan was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine (>50g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other cases being served.

superMiscConds.notes: An AODA assessment to be completed if a recent AODA has not been done, this to be determined by probation agent.
Defendant is to undergo a mental health assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Defendant is to submit to any testing probation deems appropriate.

records.addlTxt: Ltr from Judge Rider to Cindy Koltz / Taycheedah - amending JOC

ADDRESS INFO for Kimberly D Sheehan
Current: PO Box 3100, c/o Taycheedah Correctional, Fond du Lac, WI 54936-3100 United States  (Effective: 10-05-2022)
Prior: 751 County Road K, c/o Taycheedah Correctional, Fond du Lac, WI 54936-1974 United States
09/01/22 DOC ltr. RE: sentence credit - Kimberly Sheehan

9:30 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Kimberly D Sheehan appeared by video, in custody at Taycheedah Correctional.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Kimberly D Sheehan.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a plea of guilty. Court accepts the defendants guilty plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1. 

State is heard on sentence. State recommends for count one - 6 year prison sentence (3 years initial confinement / 3 years extended supervision). 
Remaining charges - State moves to dismiss (ct 2, 3, 4 dismissed on prosecutors motion) 
Court dismisses ct's 2, 3, 4. 

GUILTY - Ct 1 - 961.41(1m)(e)4 - Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>50g)
DISMISSED - Ct 2 - 961.41(1m)(cm)1r - Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g)
DISMISSED - Ct 3 - 961.573(1) - Possess Drug Paraphernalia
DISMISSED - Ct 4 - 946.49(1)(a) - Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor

Attorney Erickson is heard on sentence. Estimates January 9th - April 20th jail credit. Requests Treatment court. 

Court authorizes defendant to participate in any treatment programming. Court orders 6 year prison sentence (3 years initial confinement / 3 years extended supervision) consecutive to any other cases being served. Defendant is to undergo a mental health assessment and follow through with assessment and treatment. AODA assessment if a recent AODA has not been done, determined by probation agent. Defendant is to submit to any testing probation deems appropriate. Court Costs to be paid as a part of extended supervision. No bond money to be applied. Not eligible for the challenge release program.  Eligible for the alcohol/substance abuse program. 102 days credit.
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights
Jury instruction for possession with intent to deliver
The plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 9/6/22 was moved up at the request of Atty Erickson.  New date is 8/24/22 at 9:30 AM.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:25 PM Defendant Kimberly D Sheehan appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Kimberly D Sheehan, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Atty. Erickson states ready to move forward with Preliminary Hearing.
     Wit. #1 - Deputy Anthony Berg - sworn in, examined by Atty. Steiner.  
     1:32 p.m. - Cross by Atty. Erickson.
     1:35 - No other witnesses.  State moves to bind over.  Atty. Erickson objects to bind over.
     Court comments; finds probable cause as to the charges.  D.A. forwarding information; no change from the complaint.  Atty. Erickson prepared to move forward today with arraignment; waives formal reading of the Information; Def. stands mute.
     Court directs not guilty pleas to be entered.
     Court schedules tentative trial date of April19 -22.
     Court concludes at 1:44 p.m.
Jury status hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
